name: Leh Town
description: Capital of Ladakh at 3500m altitude, bustling market, Tibetan handicrafts, cafes, homestays, acclimatization base for high-altitude travel, Leh Main Bazaar, ancient trade route heritage, gateway to Ladakh.

name: Shanti Stupa
description: White-domed Buddhist stupa built by Japanese Buddhist organization (1991), peace pagoda, panoramic views of Leh town and Indus Valley, golden Buddha reliefs, sunrise-sunset views, 500 steps climb.

name: Leh Palace
description: 17th-century royal palace built by King Sengge Namgyal, 9-storey structure, former residence of Ladakhi royal family, Tibetan architecture inspired by Potala Palace, museum, panoramic mountain views, ruins restoration ongoing.

name: Pangong Lake
description: 134km endorheic lake at 4350m altitude, extends from India to China, crystal-clear blue water changing colors, brackish water freezes in winter, Bollywood '3 Idiots' fame, camping, migratory birds, permits required.

name: Tso Moriri Lake
description: High-altitude lake at 4522m in Changthang plateau, Ramsar Wetland Site, pristine turquoise waters, Korzok village and monastery nearby, black-necked cranes, Tibetan wild ass (Kiang), remote beauty, camping spot.

name: Nubra Valley
description: Valley of Flowers accessed via Khardung La, double-humped Bactrian camels at Hunder sand dunes, Diskit Monastery with 32m Maitreya Buddha, Shyok and Nubra river confluence, apricot orchards, cold desert landscape.

name: Khardung La Pass
description: World's highest motorable pass at 5359m (claimed), gateway to Nubra and Shyok valleys, snow-covered peaks, prayer flags, photo stop, road trip milestone, strategic military importance, oxygen thin air challenges.

name: Hemis Monastery
description: Largest and wealthiest Buddhist monastery in Ladakh, Drukpa Lineage, founded 1630, annual Hemis Festival (June-July), sacred masked Cham dances, ancient thangkas, copper statue of Buddha, Hemis National Park nearby.

name: Thiksey Monastery
description: 12-storey monastery complex resembling Potala Palace, 15th century, Gelugpa Order, 12-meter Maitreya Buddha statue, monastery museum, morning prayer assembly (6 AM), stunning Indus Valley views, 19km from Leh.

name: Diskit Monastery
description: Oldest and largest monastery in Nubra Valley, 14th-century Gelugpa Order, 32-meter Maitreya Buddha statue overlooking valley, stunning views of Shyok River, ancient murals, annual Dosmoche Festival.

name: Alchi Monastery
description: 11th-century monastery complex, one of oldest surviving Buddhist monasteries in Ladakh, Indo-Himalayan art masterpieces, wood carvings, ancient wall paintings, Lotsawa Lha-Khang temple, UNESCO tentative list, flat terrain unlike hillside monasteries.

name: Magnetic Hill
description: Gravity Hill phenomenon where vehicles appear to defy gravity and roll uphill, optical illusion caused by road layout and surrounding slopes, 30km from Leh on Leh-Kargil highway, popular tourist curiosity stop.

name: Zanskar Valley
description: Remote Himalayan valley, frozen Zanskar River Chadar Trek (winter), Phugtal Monastery in cliff cave, ancient Buddhist monasteries, trekking routes, Zanskar-Padum circuit, high-altitude desert landscape, adventure hub, challenging access.

name: Lamayuru Monastery
description: One of oldest and largest monasteries in Ladakh (10th-11th century), Moonland landscape with eroded rock formations, Red-hat (Drigung Kagyu) sect, annual Yuru Kabgyat festival with mask dances, ancient library, 127km from Leh.

name: Stok Palace & Museum
description: Current residence of Ladakhi royal family, 200-year-old palace converted to museum, royal artifacts, thangkas, crown jewels, royal attire, weapons, heritage guesthouse accommodation, Stok Kangri trek base, 15km from Leh.

name: Chang La Pass
description: Third-highest motorable pass in world at 5360m, gateway to Pangong Lake via Leh-Changthang route, prayer flags, snow-covered peaks, Chang La Baba shrine, Indian Army post, altitude sickness risk, oxygen thin.

name: Turtuk Village
description: Northernmost village accessible to tourists, captured from Pakistan in 1971, Balti culture and cuisine, apricot orchards, homestays, Turtuk Waterfall, museum showcasing Balti heritage, views of K2 range, unique cultural experience.

name: Likir Monastery
description: 11th-century Gelugpa Order monastery, 23-meter golden Maitreya Buddha statue (2000), ancient thangkas and frescoes, annual Likir Dosmoche Festival, Likir Gompa School, views of Indus Valley, 52km from Leh.

name: Diskit Festival
description: Annual Dosmoche Festival at Diskit Monastery, mask dances (Cham), colorful costumes, traditional music, Buddhist rituals, burning of evil effigies, cultural immersion, September celebration, victory of good over evil theme.

name: Hemis Festival
description: Largest and most famous Buddhist festival in Ladakh, celebrates Guru Padmasambhava's birthday at Hemis Monastery, masked Cham dance performances, traditional music, colorful costumes, sacred thangka unfurling (every 12 years), June-July.

name: Chadar Trek
description: Frozen River Trek on Zanskar River, one of most challenging winter treks in world, walk on 3-6 feet thick ice sheet, temperatures drop to -30Â°C, 9-day trek to Phugtal Monastery, extreme adventure, acclimatization crucial.

name: Siachen Base Camp
description: Gateway to world's highest battlefield, Siachen Glacier viewing point, tribute to Indian Army soldiers, special permits required, restricted access area, high-altitude challenge, patriotic destination, extreme weather conditions, limited tourist access.
